row.title: About MyPART
row.field_page_description: MyPART, the My Pediatric and Adult Rare Tumor network, is a group of scientists, patients, family members, advocates, and healthcare providers who want to help find treatments for rare cancers.
row.field_list_description: MyPART, the My Pediatric and Adult Rare Tumor network, is a group of scientists, patients, family members, advocates, and healthcare providers who want to help find treatments for rare cancers.
row.intro: Find out more about what we do, who we are, and how to contact us for more information.

row.title: Rare Tumors
row.field_page_description: Rare tumors can form anywhere in the body. My Pediatric and Adult Rare Tumor Network (MyPART) is studying tumors in several different body systems.
row.field_list_description: Rare tumors can form anywhere in the body. MyPART is studying tumors in several different body systems.
row.intro: Rare tumors can form anywhere in the body. MyPART is studying tumors in several different body systems.

row.title: News
row.field_page_description: The latest news and clinics from MyPART.
row.field_feature_card_description: MyPART hosts events and participates in scientific conferences that help promote rare tumor research.
row.field_list_description: The latest news and clinics from MyPART.
row.intro: MyPART hosts events and participates in scientific conferences that help promote rare tumor research. Check back often to read news about MyPART activities and upcoming events.

row.title: Participate
row.field_page_description: Patients, families, and advocacy organizations can participate in MyPART’s work to improve the lives of children, teens, and young adults with rare cancers.
row.field_feature_card_description: The MyPART network works best when patients, families, and advocacy organizations work together.
row.field_list_description: Patients, families, and advocacy organizations can participate in MyPART’s work to improve the lives of children, teens, and young adults with rare cancers.
row.intro: The MyPART network works best when everyone works together. We need patients, families, and advocacy organizations to help us learn as much as we can about rare cancers. Learn more about how you can participate in MyPART’s work to improve the lives of children, teens, and young adults with rare cancers.

row.title: Research
row.field_page_description: MyPART is working to address the challenges researchers face in studying rare cancers so we can find new treatments faster.
row.field_feature_card_description: MyPART is working to address the challenges researchers face in studying rare cancers.
row.field_list_description: MyPART is working to address the challenges researchers face in studying rare cancers so we can find new treatments faster.
row.intro: Research is key to finding new treatments for rare cancers. Researchers studying rare cancers face a lot of challenges. MyPART is working to address these challenges in hopes of finding new treatments faster.

row.title: Rare Tumor News
row.field_page_description: The MyPART program studies Pediatric and Adult rare tumors. Read recent news about the MyPART program and other advances in the study of rare tumors.
row.field_list_description: Recent news about the MyPART program and other advances in the study of rare tumors.
